abstract: Sergey Brin of Google and a T-Mobile executive discuss the openness of the Google phone — and its potential limits.
snippet: Sergey Brin of Google and a T-Mobile executive discuss the openness of the Google phone — and its potential limits.
lead_paragraph: It was a busy day for Sergey Brin in Manhattan. First he helped introduce the New York version of Google Transit. Then he rollerbladed 20 blocks north and west to the unveiling of the new HTC G1 phone, the first that uses Google’s Android phone software.

headline.main: ‘Radical Openness’ on the Google Phone — at Least for Now

abstract: The $179 T-Mobile G1 is the latest in a string of challenges to Apple’s popular iPhone.
snippet: The $179 T-Mobile G1 is the latest in a string of challenges to Apple’s popular iPhone.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Google and T-Mobile unveiled their answer to the iPhone on Tuesday, pulling the wraps off a slick mobile device that combines a touch screen and a keyboard and is aimed at putting the Internet in the pockets of millions of cellphone users.

headline.main: Google Introduces an iPhone Rival Open to Whims
headline.print_headline: An iPhone Rival Open to Whims

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Saul Hansell

abstract: Google and Yahoo‘s deal to let Google place some ads on Yahoo’s search pages, currently under review by the Justice Department, should be allowed with limits, the American Antitrust Institute said on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: Google and Yahoo‘s deal to let Google place some ads on Yahoo’s search pages, currently under review by the Justice Department, should be allowed with limits, the American Antitrust Institute said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Antitrust Group Urges Limits on Google-Yahoo Deal

abstract: T-Mobile has decided to drop the data limit of 1 gigabyte per month for its new phone that uses Google’s Android software.
snippet: T-Mobile has decided to drop the data limit of 1 gigabyte per month for its new phone that uses Google’s Android software.
lead_paragraph: T-Mobile raised some eyebrows Tuesday when it disclosed that buyers of its highly touted new Internet phone, the HTC G1 that uses Google’s Android software, would face restrictions if they exceeded 1 gigabyte of cellular data a month.

headline.main: T-Mobile Lifts Bandwidth Cap for Google Phone
